title: Continuous Integration
body:
### Continuous Integration

*implement continuous integration for all Repositories and Targets*
    * *requires restructuring Xcode projects per #23*
*see "What's New in Xcode" 13#400@44:30*
- [x] add repositories to Xcode Accounts

*When we try to add a local repository, Xcode does not complain but does not add the repo. When we try to add a github repository, Xcode asks for username and password, then removes the name from the field and then says that "Authentication failed because the name or password was incorrect." new Mavericks volume; 02/05/14*

* working fine now, under Xcode 6 02/16/205*

- [ ] set up Xcode Server to handle continuous integration
to install server: [How to Install and Start Using OS X Server](http://computers.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-install-and-start-using-os-x-server--mac-48261)
CI: [Xcode Continuous Integration Guide](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/xcode_guide-continuous_integration/000-About_Continuous_Integration/about_continuous_integration.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40013292-CH1-SW1)

###### for all Repositories / all Targets
- [ ] if applicable, new target installer script <TargetName>_build.py
- [ ] document steps fora testing and analysis process
- [ ] add bots for each step in testing and analysis process

###### add missing tests types
- [ ] AppleScript Testing #35
- [ ] validate HTML for documentation targets; see  #51

title: Yosemite 10.10

milestone.title: stableDev
milestone.description:
stable, standardized development environment
    includes consistency among all projects in all repositories
support and implement new CCDev scripts, project style

body:
*Switching to Yosemite has constraints, including issues, especially with Mail, with current boot volume (Mavericks on computer 5+ years old) and fact that Accessor does not yet run under Yosemite.*

### Stages and Partitions
[external partitions and stages](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3742721/5927624/702abe18-a639-11e4-84eb-963bc769b1d4.png)

## move boot volume to external Mavericks partition
#### Preparation
- [x] update [SystemInstallatiton](http://candcsoft.com/TechnicalDocs/Support/Support.html#tp_SystemInstallation), [Tools](http://candcsoft.com/TechnicalDocs/Support/Tools.html)
- [x] Mail: archive most of existing content
- [x] iTunes: Preferences > Advanced: Keep iTunes Media folder organized: On
* *see [iTunes for Mac: Moving your iTunes Media folder](http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201562)*
- [x] Media: copy iTunes library, Pictures to external partition Media
* *see [iTunes for Mac: Moving your iTunes Media folder](http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201562),[iPhoto: How to move the Library folder to a new location (archived)](http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT1229), [Move Your iPhoto Library](http://www.cultofmac.com/172491/move-your-iphoto-library-to-an-external-drive-to-save-space-os-x-tips/)*
- [x] copy Archives from ~/Archives, Aux, Ext, Backup to /Archives

#### move to new partition
- [x] fix mail issue: forward gmail to cox instead of vice-versa (cox now has IMAP, gmail has an extra all mail box); recover mail to new Cox mailboxed
- [x] [prepare, install and configure new system](http://candcsoft.com/TechnicalDocs/Support/Support.html#tp_SystemInstallation)
- [x] update archive and backupIssues scripts: move target from ~/Archives to /Archives/In or /Archives respectively

#### loose ends
- [x] Xcode Balance Delimiters: coB; Window minimize remains cM
- [x] gitmessage.txt issue: TextEdit window apparently can no longer be saved in a fixed position; Stickies window cannot be associated with a file on disk
- [x] Mail: new mail comes to Cox Inbox; gmail account disabled
- [x] Xcode: adding repositories problem; moved to #49 [Continuous Integration]
- [ ] ChronoSync: run and schedule all backups
    - [ ] Personal Data and Settings: trying to use a folder of aliases as described at [How to Backup Multiple Folders](http://www.econtechnologies.com/chronosync/guide-backup-multiple-folders.html) Option 6. Chronosync just copied the aliases. Follow up (Ticket#2015020710000106); backup Personal Data and Settings
    - [x] run Archives and MacMirror synchronizations
    - [ ] schedule all backups

## Accessor issue
- [x] fix Accessor testing; see carolclark/Accessor#19

## switch to Xcode 6
- [x] install Xcode 6 for testing
- [x] upgrade projects as needed
       - [x] replace uses of nil as a number with 0
- [ ] switch to Xcode 6
    - [ ] update project settings to recommended
    - [ ] switch to new command-line tools (Preferences > Locations)

## move to Yosemite
*When we try to open Accessor under Yosemite, system says it needs a download for it to run. After the download, Accessor opens its window but does not start listening.*
*See carolclark/Accessor#16 [upgrade for Yosemite].*
- [ ] Accessor: runs under Yosemite; see carolclark/Accessor#16
- [ ] for new primary drive, [prepare, install and configure new system](http://candcsoft.com/TechnicalDocs/Support/Support.html#tp_SystemInstallation)

title: Imports and Modules
body:
use modules to replace/augment pch files in ObjC projects (What's New in Xcode 5 13#400@22:20)

* Motivation
    * modules are more advanced technology available for use in Objective-C code
    * due to reliance on prefix files, files do not #include or #import the headers as they should
    * in Accessor, the prefix file is apparently interfering with creation of pure Objective-C and files because the automatically-included code is not valid Objective-C code

- [ ] add the appropriate include/import statements to existing class headers to explicitly include the files from the prefix header
- [ ] use modules instead of the prefix header for Objective-C code

* *see also carolclark/Accessor#12*

title: Standardize and Upgrade 10.9
body:
### Status 12/31/2014
* OS X 10.9 Mavericks is current as of WWDC13
* Xcode 5 his been adopted; Mavericks to be installed soon
* some recommended tasks from previous OS X versions were not completed
* we have also learned a lot in some areas, especially testing, that we need to implement

This issue collects multiple github issues relating to these items for planning, organizing and tracking.



##### Rebuild Projects
- [ ] #23 rebuild simpler Xcode projects

##### Upgrade History Files
- [ ] #3 adopt GitHub Issues and Markdown

##### Backup and Maintenance
- [ ] #4 establish and implement full backup procedure

##### By Project
- [ ] #11 testing: code coverage tool(s)

##### C-based languages
- [ ] #12 modernize Objective-C
- [ ] #8 establish stronger compiler error recognition
- [ ] #7 establish Objective-C coding standards
- [ ] #9 organize Objective-C code consistently
- [ ] #10 implement Private Categories

##### iOS; Interface Builder

##### Unclassified

- [ ] #13 profile with Instruments
- [ ] #16 distribution and entitlements
- [ ] #17 implement scheduled maintenance
- [ ] #20 upgrade LLDB debugging support
- [ ] #21 git workflow support
- [ ] #22 convert scripts ccInstall and archive to Python
- [ ] #24 improve TechnicalDocs upload
- [ ] #25 add Finder target
- [ ] #29 Mavericks
- [ ] #30 Convert to ARC
- [ ] #31 Python and Workflow support
- [ ] #32 Doxygen: build for supported collaborator environments
- [ ] #35 AppleScript testing
- [x] #36 remove non-ascii characters
- [ ] carolclark/Punkin#2 configure for AppStore
- [ ] carolclark/Punkin#5 refactor for testability
- [ ] carolclark/Punkin#6 handle PaintCode files
- [ ] carolclark/Accessor#5 adopt a C++ unit testing tool
- [ ] carolclark/Accessor#6 secure automation
- [ ] carolclark/Accessor#7 upgrade C++ wrapper classes to use ivars
- [ ] carolclark/Accessor#8 migrate to ARC

title: add Finder target

milestone.title: stableDev
milestone.description:
stable, standardized development environment
    includes consistency among all projects in all repositories
support and implement new CCDev scripts, project style

body:
recover script toTEXT; include documentation for changing creator and/or file type

on open filelist
	tell application "Finder"
		repeat with onefile in filelist
			set file type of onefile to "TEXT"
		end repeat
	end tell
end open

on run
	choose file with prompt "Select one or more files to convert to TEXT format:" with multiple selections allowed
	open (the result as list)
end run

title: restructure Xcode projects

milestone.title: stableDev
milestone.description:
stable, standardized development environment
    includes consistency among all projects in all repositories
support and implement new CCDev scripts, project style

body:
*Xcode project files are fragile and easily corrupted.  According to forum discussions, corrupted project files sometimes require rebuilding from scratch, and contain information that is not saved elsewhere.*
*The problem is compounded by version control, since any change to the files or settings of a project causes the project to be changed, and therefore possibly subject to merge conflicts. This is of particular concern for Punkin, which has an Artist collaborator.*
*We set the git attributes for project files to `merge=union`, which helps but does not solve the problem.*
*In addition, the new Continuous Integration support expects targets to have their test targets attached, which is not always what we have done.*

* set up to support cross-product references
* switch to Base Internationalization
	* *for compatibility with new project template's file structure; new localization technique uses a different organization for nib files*
* reorganize so:
    * repositories contain multiple focused projects as indicated
    * files are organized:
        * within Projects, by target
        * within Targets, with subfolders Classes/ (AppDelegate, Controllers, Models, Helpers, ...),  Resources/ (Nibs, Assets, DataModels, ...), Other Sources
    * each main target has a corresponding test target
         * also add targets AllTargets for now (until CI implemented)
* minimize dependence on information stored in project files
    * document each Repository's folder structure: Projects, Targets, dependencies
 
Related:
use configuration files to replace most build settings - see #52
use modules to replace pch files #40

- [x] carolclark/Punkin#7
- [ ] carolclark/Accessor#10

See
* [Code Organization in Xcode Projects (akosma)](http://akosma.com/2009/07/28/code-organization-in-xcode-projects/)
* [Merging Xcode project files](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4022362/merging-xcode-project-files)
* [Google example config files](http://code.google.com/p/google-toolbox-for-mac/source/browse/trunk/XcodeConfig/)
* [Easy, Modular: Static Libraries and Cross-Project References](http://www.clintharris.net/2009/iphone-app-shared-libraries/)
* [Xcode 5 and iOS 7: Architecture and Valid architectures](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18913906/xcode-5-and-ios-7-architecture-and-valid-architectures)

title: convert scripts ccInstall and archive to Python
body:
* *Python appears a better choice for producing robust, testable shell scripts; see also #18 "clean up UNIX error handling"*
* *Python also is used to customize LLDB, and has the capability to be extended in embedded in a way that looks practical as a way to replace the Rez language as a way to define Slates in Accessor.*
* *Cdoc html files were placed in a separate folder to accommodate ccInstall's limitations. Those files are now harder to preview because the source folder has a different structure from the target site.*

see [Python for Bash Scripters](http://magazine.redhat.com/2008/02/07/python-for-bash-scripters-a-well-kept-secret/), [A Clean Python Shell Script](http://www.jperla.com/blog/post/a-clean-python-shell-script)

- [ ] [Python Tutorial](http://docs.python.org/2/tutorial/)

title: git workflow support
body:
see [How to avoid these merge commits in the future](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6406762/why-am-i-merging-remote-tracking-branch-origin-develop-into-develop), [A few git tips you didn't know about](http://mislav.uniqpath.com/2010/07/git-tips/), [github/hub](https://github.com/github/hub)

*11/02/2013 github/hub not used for now; what we know well enough to abbreviate, we already automate; Tips has some additional ideas that might be useful later*

#### Add to Accessor Slates
*From [A few git tips you didn't know about](http://mislav.uniqpath.com/2010/07/git-tips/)*
- [ ] add --decorate to lg alias to included tags, and possibly additional branch information
- [ ] add --word-diff option to diff; document
- X (Made unnecessary by git version 1.8.3.4, installed with Xcode 5) pushing branches with tracking
    * add --set-upstream (establish tracking) to push options 
    * git config --global push.default tracking - to push only the current branch
    * document
- [ ] add --track to checkout options; document
- [ ] add name-rev to show where among tags a specific commit was made; document

#### Additional Scripting and Alias support
- [ ] refactor: for all unix files, includes come before help info to keep file's help from being overwritten by that from includes
- [ ] handle items for which Slates now enter scripts (eg. diff/list)
    * branch / getCurrent
    * tag / annotate
    * difference / (specs) / listFiles; selectFile
- [ ] customize terminal prompt with git branch
    * see [Put Your Git Branch in Your Bash Prompt](http://code-worrier.com/blog/git-branch-in-bash-prompt/)

title: migrate Cdoc from HTML/sed to Markdown
body:
###### *Current Cdoc: existing in-house system for producing website for technical documentation*
* *created several years ago to simplify some aspects, especially accessibility features, for our in-house documentation*
* *currently uses a `sed`-based mechanism for expanding special features; JavaScript might be better*
* *current Cdoc history files do not scale well, especially for multiple developers, and represent a large investment in attempting to track what we're doing, with limited success*

###### *Markdown: publicly-available perl script to produce web content from readable text files*
* *much simpler and more collaborator-friendly*
* *can contain embedded HTML*
* *translators are available to convert markdown to HTML and HTML to markdown*
* *GitHub uses `markdown` for text rendering; Cdoc uses HTML. For collaborator-friendly editing, `markdown` provides a huge advantage compared with HTML.*

##### Conclusion
* over time, attempt to implement special features in css and JavaScript for Markdown as well as `sed` translation
    * Markdown files can include HTML content, but Cdoc HTML features will be supported only from Cdoc HTML files
* eventually, convert existing Cdoc source to markdown
    * see
        * [Markdown Tools](http://brettterpstra.com/projects/markdown-service-tools) and/or Markdownify for conversion from HTML
        * [Markdown config](http://candcsoft/TechnicalDocs/Support/Tools#_Markdown)
        * earlier Cdoc/Markdown issues #3 adopt GitHub issues, #55 support Markdown files

title: modernize Objective-C
body:
* see [Modern Objective-C12#405](https://developer.apple.com/videos/wwdc/2012/index.php?id=405), [Migrating to Modern Objective-C 12#413](https://developer.apple.com/videos/wwdc/2012/index.php?id=405),*What's New in Xcode 5  13#400@25:00*

* also see carolclark/Accessor#7 for Objective-C++ ivars

- [x] adopt C++ 11 (already done?)

- [ ] use typed enums:
typedef enum NSNumberFormatterStyle : NSUInteger {
    ...
} NSNumberFormatterStyle;
verify with -Wconversion?

- [ ] use object literals; see http://clang.llvm.org/docs/ObjectiveCLiterals.html
- [ ] property synthesis: declare property only; declaration of ivar, @synthesize statement no longer needed (ivar for property name is _name)
    *Core Data NSManagedObject opts out of synthesize by default*

warnings and analyzer settings
